BUZZ: A continuous, humming noise, as of bees; a confused murmur, as of general conversation in low tones.
FADE: A golf shot that (for the right-handed player) curves intentionally to the right. See slice, hook, draw.
FAUXHAWK: An imitation of the Mohawk (=UK Mohican) hairstyle in which a central tuft is created using gel without having to shave the sides of the head.
FLATTOP: A short haircut in which the hair is brushed straight up then cut flat across the top.
PAGEBOY: A boy who serves as a page.
PIXIE: (fantasy literature, fairy tales) A playful sprite or elflike or fairy-like creature.
SHAG: Matted material; rough massed hair, fibres etc.
